summary: This bill, the SAWMILL Act, aims to support the American wood and mill infrastructure through the Timber Production Expansion Guaranteed Loan Program. It directs the Secretary of Agriculture, in coordination with the Secretary of the Interior, to identify Federal land suitable for ecological restoration involving vegetation removal. The bill allows eligible entities (sawmills/wood-processing facilities) located near these lands to receive loan guarantees to establish, reopen, or improve their facilities.  The total amount for loan guarantees is capped at $220 million.
